author: Mark Zastrow
description: New simulations of how thunderstorms drive electrical currents through the Earth's atmosphere combine precision with computational speed.
title: Lightning "Impulses" Improve Models of Global Electrical Circuit

author: David Shultz
description: The 2008 earthquake surprised scientists, but the inclusion of new variables reveals that Earth's crust under the Sichuan Province was under more strain than previously thought.
title: New Models Explain Unexpected Magnitude of China's Wenchuan Quake

author: Terri Cook
description: First comprehensive analysis of deep radar data gives insight into the dynamics and history of the Greenland Ice Sheet.
title: Ice-Penetrating Radar Reveals Age of Greenland Ice Sheet Layers

author: Chris Palmer
description: Remote estimation of fluorescence emitted by plants can indicate variations in photosynthesis performance.
title: Airborne Sensor Can Track Photosynthesis Efficiency

author: Kate Wheeling
description: Field experiments examine the effect of rising temperatures and drying soils on carbon dynamics in the Arctic.
title: Simulating a Warmer, Drier Arctic

author: Puneet Kollipara
description: Basing forecasts on data that preserve variations over space yield more reliable predictions than using standard numerical measures of climatic cycles' intensity.
title: What Climate Information Is Most Useful for Predicting Floods?

author: David Shultz
description: Sediment cores show how phosphorus pollution in the 1950s led to current, inherited hypoxia in lakes in the Alps.
title: Past Phosphorus Runoff Causes Present Oxygen Depletion in Lakes

author: David Shultz
description: Hurricane Sandy moved a lot of debris, but where did it all end up?
title: Underwater Robot Tracked Ocean Sediment During Hurricane Sandy

author: Catherine Minnehan
description: Researchers look at previous Walker circulation models and ask, Does damping truly matter?
title: Rethinking How Tropical Convection Works

author: Chris Palmer
description: Since the mid-20th century, increased urbanization along the southern California coast has raised nighttime temperatures, resulting in less morning fog and cloud cover.
title: Urbanization Threatens Drought-Reducing Clouds in California
